question_details.title: Will 900,000 Russian personnel losses be reported before March 21, 2025?
question_details.description:
Since the beginning of the Russian invasion in 2022, the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine releases their daily estimation of Russian losses in personnel, vehicles, aircraft, and other military equipment on their pages in social networks (see links in Resolution Criteria).

On February 19, 2025, they [reported](https://mod.gov.ua/en/news/the-estimated-combat-losses-of-russians-over-the-last-day-1-300-persons-175-ua-vs-and-72-artillery-systems) a total of 862,390 estimated casualties. At the same time the daily rate is being constantly above 1000 since July 25, 2024. With the pace of 1300 casualties per day the number of 900,000 casualties should be reached on March 20, 2025.

Historical data can be tracked by independent trackers
such as [russian-casualties-in-ua](https://russian-casualties.in.ua/) , [Combat.FYI](https://combat.fyi/) and in the [2022-Ukraine-Russia-War-Dataset](https://github.com/PetroIvaniuk/2022-Ukraine-Russia-War-Dataset/blob/main/data/russia_losses_personnel.json).
question_details.resolution_criteria:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before March 21, 2025, the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine reports 900,000 or more total Russian personnel losses on their [official site](https://mod.gov.ua/en/news?tags=Combat) or public media pages ([Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/GeneralStaff.ua), [Telegram](https://t.me/GeneralStaffZSU), [X.com](https://x.com/GeneralStaffUA)).

If all reports published before March 21, 2025 show numbers below 900,000, this question resolves as **No**. This includes the case when the General Staff of the AFU stops publishing their data due to a ceasefire or peace agreement.
question_details.fine_print:
* "Personnel losses" in this context are *killed and wounded* soldiers and that wounded soldiers may return to the battlefield later.
* In the past there was at least one occasion on [May 27, 2023](https://www.facebook.com/GeneralStaff.ua/posts/594141432898939?ref=embed_post) when the error in the previous day's report was admitted and corrected. For this reason, the question will resolve two days later than any published report, although it will retroactively close before the date the report was first published.
* Historical trackers mentioned in the Background information ([russian-casualties-in-ua](https://russian-casualties.in.ua/), [Combat.FYI](https://combat.fyi/) and the [2022-Ukraine-Russia-War-Dataset](https://github.com/PetroIvaniuk/2022-Ukraine-Russia-War-Dataset/blob/main/data/russia_losses_personnel.json)) may be used as secondary resolution sources if the main resolution pages are banned/unavailable.

news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Ukraine Fails to Meet Mobilization Targets, Suffers Heavy Losses**
The Russian Ministry of Defense reports that Ukraine has failed to meet its mobilization targets, with less than 28,000 people mobilized in February 2025, while the Ukrainian military has suffered losses of over 38,000 soldiers. According to the Ministry, '... despite the launch of the so-called 'new contract 18-24' by the Kiev regime on February 11 of this year to attract Ukrainian youth on a voluntary basis to the ranks of the VSU, it is not possible to recruit even a few thousand 'volunteers'...' The Ministry also notes that in January 2025, around 28,000 people were mobilized through the TCC, while the total losses of Ukrainian servicemen reached 51,960. In December 2024, mobilization affected around 33,000 people, with losses of 48,470 Ukrainian servicemen. In November, around 34,000 people were mobilized, with losses of 60,805 Ukrainian servicemen. Since the start of the special military operation, the Ukrainian military has suffered losses of around 1.08 million people, including killed and wounded, with over 60,000 of these losses occurring in the Kursk region.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 01, 2025 03:27 PM
Source:[URA.RU](https://ura.news/news/1052896407)

**Russia Loses Record Number of Vehicles in February**
In February, Ukraine's military damaged or destroyed a record number of Russian vehicles, including 3,472 units of automotive transport and tankers, and 596 armored vehicles. According to the Ministry of Defense, this is the highest number of vehicles destroyed in a single month since the start of the war. Additionally, 3,274 combat encounters took place in February, down from 5,087 in January. The number of Russian airstrikes on Ukrainian positions and rear cities also increased. The Russian tactical aviation dropped over 3,522 kamikaze drones (KABo) in February, up from 2,400 in January. Furthermore, 331 enemy tanks were destroyed or put out of commission, the highest number in the past seven months. Ukrainian forces also destroyed and damaged 1,415 enemy artillery systems, enough to equip over 78 artillery divisions. The General Staff of the Ukrainian Armed Forces reported that the Russian army suffered significant irrecoverable and sanitary losses in February, with 36,570 personnel casualties. This is the highest number of personnel losses since December 2024, when 48,670 losses were reported. The Russian occupation forces have been buying donkeys to transport ammunition and equipment due to high losses of automotive equipment. Meanwhile, the State Duma quickly responded by stating that the use of animals on the front is a 'normal' phenomenon.
Original language: uk
Publish date: March 01, 2025 11:21 AM
Source:[Украинская сеть новостей](https://ua.korrespondent.net/ukraine/4760053-rosiia-vtratyla-rekordnu-kilkist-avtotekhniky)

**Ukraine Reports Decrease in Battles, Increase in Russian Airstrikes**
According to the Ministry of Defense, the number of battles on the front line decreased in February, but the number of Russian airstrikes on Ukrainian positions increased. In February, there were 3,274 battles, compared to 5,087 in January. The Russian tactical aviation dropped over 3,522 kamikaze drones in February, compared to around 2,400 guided aviation bombs in January. The General Staff of the Ukrainian Armed Forces reported that 'in February, the Russian army suffered significant irreparable and sanitary losses of personnel, totaling 36,570 people, which is the number of three motorized rifle divisions.' The Ukrainian Defense Forces destroyed and damaged: 'The largest number of enemy vehicles in the shortest month of the year, 3,472 units of automotive and tanker vehicles,' said the Ministry of Defense. According to the General Staff of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, as of March 1, Russia has lost around 875,610 soldiers since the start of the full-scale invasion, including 1,050 in the last day. Additionally, the Russian forces lost more than 10 tanks and 15 infantry fighting vehicles in a day. Russia and Ukraine have not provided information on their losses in the war. Moscow last officially reported the number of killed in September 2022, stating 5,937 deaths. Western sources estimate the number of Russian dead and wounded to be over 600,000, not including North Korean soldier losses. According to the Commander-in-Chief of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, Alexander Syrskyi, Russia lost over 48,000 soldiers during battles on the Kurks region, including around 20,000 killed. Ukraine has not reported losses for a long time, stating that the data will be revealed after the war. However, President Volodymyr Zelensky stated in an interview with NBC News on February 16 that Ukraine lost over 46,000 soldiers killed and around 380,000 wounded since February 2022. On February 4, 2025, he reported that Ukraine lost 45,100 soldiers killed and 390,000 wounded since the start of the war. Zelensky estimated that Russia lost 600-700,000 soldiers wounded and 300-350,000 killed, and that 50-70,000 Russians are missing.
Original language: uk
Publish date: March 01, 2025 11:03 AM
Source:[Радіо Свобода](https://www.radiosvoboda.org/a/news-minoborony-viyna-rosiya-front-zsu/33332585.html)

**Russia Suffers Heavy Losses in February, Ukrainian Defenders Destroy Record Number of Vehicles**
In February, Ukrainian defenders destroyed the largest number of Russian vehicles since the start of the full-scale invasion, with 3,472 units of automotive and tanker transport, as well as 596 combat armored vehicles. According to the Ministry of Defense, the number of enemy air strikes on positions and rear settlements also increased. The Russian tactical aviation dropped over 3,522 KABs in February, compared to around 2,400 guided bombs in January. Additionally, 331 enemy tanks were damaged or destroyed, the highest number of losses in this category of military equipment in the past seven months. The General Staff of the Ukrainian Armed Forces reported that the Russian army suffered significant irrecoverable and medical losses, with 36,570 personnel casualties in February. This is the second-highest number of losses for the Russian army, after 48,670 in December 2024.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 01, 2025 10:53 AM
Source:[Українська правда](https://www.pravda.com.ua/rus/news/2025/03/1/7500797/)

**Ukrainian Defense Forces Report Significant Losses for Russian Army**
The Ukrainian Defense Forces have reported that the Russian army has lost 1050 soldiers, 11 tanks, and 61 artillery systems in the past day. According to the General Staff of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, the total estimated losses of the enemy from February 24, 2022 to March 1, 2025 are: 'The General Staff of the Ukrainian Armed Forces has updated the data on the enemy's losses: 1,050 soldiers, 11 tanks, and 61 artillery systems were lost by the Russian army in the past day.' The General Staff also provided a breakdown of the overall losses of the enemy from February 24, 2022 to March 1, 2025.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 01, 2025 06:07 AM
Source:[Українська правда](https://www.pravda.com.ua/rus/news/2025/03/1/7500771/)

**Ukrainian Defense Forces Eliminate 1,050 Russian Occupiers**
According to the General Staff of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, the Russian occupying forces lost 1,050 soldiers and various units of equipment and technology over the past day. The total estimated losses of the enemy from February 24, 2022 to March 1, 2025 are approximately: - 875,610 personnel, - 10,233 tanks, - 21,249 armored vehicles, - 23,908 artillery systems, - 27,402 operational-tactical drones, - 39,101 units of automotive and tanker equipment. The General Staff of the Ukrainian Armed Forces reports that the Russians are most actively attacking in certain areas. 'The enemy continues to suffer significant losses, which is a testament to the bravery and determination of our soldiers,' said the General Staff in a statement.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 01, 2025 05:28 AM
Source:[Gazeta.ua](https://gazeta.ua/ru/articles/np/_sily-oborony-likvidirovali-esche-1050-rossijskih-okkupantov/1210010)

**Russia Reports Over 240 Ukrainian Military Casualties in Kursk**
Russia reported over 240 Ukrainian military casualties in Kursk over the past 24 hours, as well as 12 armored combat vehicles and other material damage. The Russian Defense Ministry stated, 'During the last day, the losses of the Ukrainian Armed Forces were over 240 military personnel, one armored transport was destroyed, 12 armored combat vehicles, 22 cars, four artillery pieces, including a self-propelled howitzer Bogdana, six mortars, two electronic warfare stations, one radioelectronic reconnaissance station, as well as seven unmanned aerial vehicle control points and three ammunition depots.' Meanwhile, Russian forces liberated the towns of Novolyubovka in the Lugansk People's Republic and Topoli in the Kharkiv region. The Russian president, Vladimir Putin, claimed that the military operation in eastern Ukraine aims to protect 'a genocide by the Kiev regime' and stop the national security threats posed by NATO's expansion to the east. According to Moscow, since the start of the operation in Kursk in August 2024, Ukraine has lost 64,075 military personnel, 382 tanks, 290 infantry fighting vehicles, 248 armored personnel carriers, 2,084 armored combat vehicles, 2,251 cars, 495 artillery pieces, and 52 multiple launch rocket systems, including 13 HIMARS and 7 MLRS.
Original language: es
Publish date: March 01, 2025 12:11 AM
Source:[teleSURtv.net](https://www.telesurtv.net/rusia-reporta-mas-de-240-bajas-ucranianas-en-kursk-durante-ultimas-24-horas/)

**Russia loses 1,060 troops and 54 artillery systems in past 24 hours**
According to the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Russian forces have suffered 1,060 soldier casualties and 387 losses of military equipment, including 54 artillery systems, in the past 24 hours. The total combat losses of Russian forces from February 24, 2022, to February 28, 2025, are estimated to be significant, with ongoing updates from intelligence leading to revisions in the reported figures. The General Staff has confirmed that only the overall loss figures have been adjusted, while daily losses continue to be reported as usual.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 28, 2025 06:27 AM
Source:[Українська правда](https://www.pravda.com.ua/eng/news/2025/02/28/7500573/)

**Ukrainian Forces Report Significant Losses of Russian Military Equipment and Personnel**
The General Staff of the Ukrainian Armed Forces has released statistics on the losses of the Russian army as of the morning of February 28, 2025. According to the information portal 'My Kyiv Region', citing the General Staff, the approximate total combat losses of the enemy from February 24, 2022 to February 28, 2025 are: approximately 874,560 personnel (+1,060), 10,222 tanks (+13), 21,234 armored fighting vehicles (+17), 23,847 artillery systems (+54), 1,303 multiple rocket launchers (+1), 1,087 air defense systems (+0), 370 aircraft (+0), 331 helicopters (+0), 27,274 drones (+172), 3,085 cruise missiles (+0), 28 ships/boats (+0), 1 submarine (+0), 38,994 vehicles and tanker trucks (+126), and 3,763 special equipment (+4).
Original language: uk
Publish date: February 28, 2025 12:00 AM
Source:[mykyivregion.com.ua](https://mykyivregion.com.ua/news/sili-oboroni-za-minulu-dobu-znishhili-1060-okupantiv-ta-54-artsistemi)

**Russia Loses 1300 Soldiers and 26 Artillery Systems in 24 Hours**
According to the General Staff of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, the Russian army lost 1300 soldiers, 26 artillery systems, and 122 unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) in the past 24 hours. The total losses of the Russian military from February 24, 2022 to February 25, 2025 are estimated to be: approximately 869,530 soldiers killed, 10,182 tanks, 21,168 armored vehicles, 23,652 artillery systems, 1,299 multiple rocket launchers, 1,083 air defense systems, 370 aircraft, 331 helicopters, 26,767 UAVs, 3,064 cruise missiles, 28 ships, 1 submarine, 38,582 vehicles, and 3,759 special equipment. As stated by the General Staff, 'the enemy continues to suffer significant losses, which are a testament to the effectiveness of the Ukrainian military's actions.'
Original language: ru
Publish date: February 25, 2025 08:45 AM
Source:[telegrafua.com](https://telegrafua.com/news/za-mynuvshye-sutky-rossyiane-poterialy-na-fronte-1300-soldat-y-2-systemy-pvo-henshtab/)

**Russia's Losses on the Frontline: Over 860,000 Military Personnel and Thousands of Tanks**
According to a report by the British Ministry of Defence, Russia has lost over 860,000 military personnel, thousands of tanks, and 8,400 armored vehicles since the start of the full-scale invasion of Ukraine. Despite these significant losses, Russia continues to push forward, relying on its numerical superiority and Soviet-era stockpiles of equipment. The report notes that the quality of Russian forces has significantly decreased, with many new recruits receiving minimal training and the command using a 'quantity over quality' approach, sacrificing lives for progress. Russia is compensating for its losses in equipment by drawing on its Soviet-era stockpiles of tanks and armored vehicles. The report also notes that, despite the significant losses, the Russian army continues to launch attacks due to its numerical superiority and the willingness of the Kremlin's leadership to accept losses. The report states that Russia's territorial advances in 2024 accelerated, but slowed down at the beginning of 2025. However, the threat remains, as the Russian command is prepared for a prolonged war, relying on its numerical superiority and resource reserves.
Original language: uk
Publish date: February 24, 2025 02:12 PM
Source:[24 Канал](https://24tv.ua/vtrati-voroga-fronti-rosiya-vtratila-860-tisyach-viyskovih-tisne_n2760808)

**Russian Army Loses 1,280 More Soldiers**
According to the General Staff of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, the total estimated losses of the Russian army from February 24, 2022 to February 21, 2025 are approximately 864,860 personnel, with an additional 1,280 losses reported on February 21. The Ukrainian military also reported the destruction or damage of 12 tanks, 18 armored vehicles, 52 artillery systems, 4 multiple rocket launchers, 2 air defense systems, 135 unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs), 134 units of automotive equipment and tankers, and 1 special equipment unit. 'The total estimated losses of the enemy from February 24, 2022 to February 21, 2025 are approximately: personnel - about 864,860 (+1,280) people', the General Staff of the Ukrainian Armed Forces reported on February 21.
Original language: uk
Publish date: February 21, 2025 06:30 AM
Source:[ostro.org](https://www.ostro.org/news/rosijska-armiya-vtratyla-shhe-1280-vijskovyh-i512211)

**Russia's Military Strength: A Report by the IISS**
According to a report by the International Institute for Strategic Studies (IISS), Russia has suffered significant losses on the front lines, with approximately 1,400 main battle tanks (MBTs) and over 3,700 infantry fighting vehicles (IFVs) and armored personnel carriers (APCs) lost in 2024. In total, Russia has lost around 14,000 MBTs, IFVs, and APCs since the start of the full-scale invasion of Ukraine. Despite these staggering numbers, Russia has been able to recover some of these losses by relying on Soviet-era equipment. However, the equipment that remains in storage is likely to be in a worn-out state, which could hinder Russia's ability to provide sufficient equipment to compensate for the losses. The IISS report notes that by the end of 2024, the number of active Russian equipment had only reached the level of February 2022, and the significant expansion of units has exacerbated the shortage of equipment. The main problem facing Russia is the lack of IFVs and APCs, even at higher production rates. However, Russia has adapted its tactics to mitigate these problems by relying on temporary measures and further infantry attacks, according to the IISS. The report estimates that by the start of January 2025, at least 172,000 Russian soldiers had been killed and 611,000 wounded, with at least 376,000 suffering severe injuries (invalids), and a total of 235,000 wounded but recoverable. The Russian mobilization, including forced mobilization in occupied Donbas, mobilization in 2022, and the prisoner recruitment, has allowed for the formation of around 976,000 personnel for participation in the war. Therefore, according to the IISS, by the end of December 2024, there will be around 617,000 personnel deployed in Ukraine or nearby, including wounded recoverable personnel and those undergoing training. 'Although Russian forces are likely to degrade in the coming months, they are sufficiently restored and adapted to support offensive operations for at least another year. However, this will come at a great cost in terms of equipment and personnel losses,' the report states.
Original language: uk
Publish date: February 12, 2025 01:04 PM
Source:[РБК-Украина](https://www.rbc.ua/rus/news/rosiya-zaznala-prigolomshlivih-vtrat-fronti-1739364942.html)

**Russia's Losses in January 2025: Over 48,000 Personnel**
According to British intelligence, Russia likely suffered its second-largest personnel losses in January 2025, after December 2024. The UK Ministry of Defence reported that Russia lost 48,240 personnel, including killed and wounded, in January, which is slightly lower than the record 48,670 losses in December. Experts predict that Russia's total losses in 2025 may exceed 50,000, and the overall number of losses since the start of the war in Ukraine in February 2022 may reach over 837,000. The General Staff of the Ukrainian Armed Forces reported that Russia lost an average of 1,556 personnel per day in January, which is the second-highest daily loss after December's record of 1,570. Experts note that the number of losses above 1,000 per day in February 2025 is likely to be maintained, reflecting the intensity of Russian military operations and advances. 'The intensity of Russian military operations and advances is likely to continue,' said experts. 'The number of losses above 1,000 per day in February 2025 is likely to be maintained.'
Original language: uk
Publish date: February 05, 2025 04:32 PM
Source:[bigmir)net](https://news.bigmir.net/ua/world/9986868-za-yanvar-2025-goda-rossiya-poteryala-pochti-50-tysyach-chelovek-britanskaya-razvedka)

**Russia's Military Losses Continue to Mount, Exceeding 1,000 Per Day**
According to the UK Ministry of Defence, Russia has lost over 837,000 military personnel since the invasion in February 2022. The report states that the Russian military's high tempo of operations is resulting in significant losses. In January 2025, Russia lost over 48,000 soldiers, with daily losses exceeding 1,000. Experts estimate that this trend will continue in February, with average daily losses exceeding 1,000. As reported by the UK Ministry of Defence, 'The indicator of Russian losses is likely to continue to exceed 1,000 per day on average in February 2025,'. The highest average daily loss was recorded in January, with 1,556 personnel lost, narrowly missing the December 2024 record of 1,570. Experts note that these significant losses reflect the high tempo of Russian military operations.
Original language: uk
Publish date: February 05, 2025 01:47 PM
Source:[ТСН.ua](https://tsn.ua/ato/skilki-okupantiv-pomre-u-lyutomu-v-minoboroni-britaniyi-nazvali-cifru-2760219.html)

**British Intelligence: Russia's Losses Continue to Exceed 1,000 Per Day**
According to British intelligence, January 2025 was likely the second most costly month for Russia in the war, with a total of 48,240 losses (killed and wounded), as reported by the General Staff of Ukraine. The most costly month to date was December 2024, with 48,670 Russian losses. 'Russia is likely to have suffered over 50,000 losses in 2025 and over 837,000 losses since the invasion of Ukraine in February 2022,' the report states. In January 2025, a second-highest daily average of Russian losses in the conflict was recorded, with 1,556 personnel lost per day, according to the Ukrainian General Staff. This is not significantly different from the December 2024 average of 1,570 personnel lost per day, which was the highest daily average of Russian losses in the conflict to date. 'We expect the average number of Russian losses to continue exceeding 1,000 per day in February 2025, reflecting the high tempo of Russian operations and offensive actions,' British analysts conclude.
Original language: uk
Publish date: February 05, 2025 01:05 PM
Source:[glavnoe.in.ua](https://glavnoe.in.ua/news/rozvidka-brytaniyi-serednya-kilkist-rosijskyh-vtrat-prodovzhuvatyme-perevyshhuvaty-1000-osib-na-den)

**UK Intelligence Predicts High Russian Losses in February 2025**
According to the UK Ministry of Defence, Russia has lost over 50,000 personnel in 2025 and over 837,000 since the invasion of Ukraine in February 2022. The UK intelligence also predicts that Russia's losses will likely exceed 1,000 personnel per day in February 2025, reflecting the high tempo of Russian operations. This is based on the data from January 2025, which saw a record 48,240 Russian losses, including both killed and wounded. The UK Ministry of Defence stated, 'The indicator of Russian losses is likely to continue to exceed 1,000 personnel per day in February 2025, reflecting the high tempo of Russian operations and advances.' 
Original language: uk
Publish date: February 05, 2025 12:55 PM
Source:[РБК-Украина](https://www.rbc.ua/rus/news/britanska-rozvidka-dala-prognoz-kilkosti-1738760096.html)

**Russian Losses: Over 825,000 Personnel and 22,256 Artillery Systems Lost**
The General Staff has released statistics on Russian army losses as of January 23, 2025. The approximate total losses of the enemy from February 24, 2022 to January 23, 2025 are: personnel - around 825,320 (+1,340) individuals, tanks - 9,850 (+6), armored vehicles - 20,497 (+12), artillery systems - 22,256 (+62), multiple rocket launchers - 1,262 (+0), air defense systems - 1,050 (+0), aircraft - 369 (+0), helicopters - 331 (+0), unmanned aerial vehicles - 23,111 (+72), cruise missiles - 3,051 (+0), ships / boats - 28 (+0), submarines - 1 (+0), automotive equipment and tankers - 34,905 (+68), special equipment - 3,714 (+3).
Original language: uk
Publish date: January 23, 2025 12:00 AM
Source:[mykyivregion.com.ua](https://mykyivregion.com.ua/news/vtrati-rosiyan-za-minulu-dobu-minus-1340-okupantiv-ta-62-artsistemi)

**Russian Losses as of January 22, 2025**
As of January 22, 2025, the General Staff of the Ukrainian Armed Forces reported the following losses for the Russian occupation forces: approximately 823,980 personnel, 9,844 tanks, 20,485 armored vehicles, 22,194 artillery systems, 1,262 multiple rocket launchers, 1,050 air defense systems, 369 aircraft, 331 helicopters, 22,039 drones, 3,051 cruise missiles, 28 ships, 1 submarine, and 34,837 vehicles. The Russian fleet's activity in the Black Sea, Azov Sea, and Mediterranean Sea was also reported, with a total of 11 ships passing through the Kerch Strait in the past day, including four ships continuing towards the Bosphorus.
Original language: uk
Publish date: January 22, 2025 05:34 AM
Source:[glavcom.ua](https://glavcom.ua/country/incidents/vtrati-voroha-stanom-na-22-sichnja-2025-henshtab-zsu-1041590.html)

**Ukrainian Forces Report 1600 Russian Casualties in 24 Hours**
According to the General Staff of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, the Russian army lost 1600 soldiers in a single day. The total losses of Russia in the war against Ukraine as of January 21, 2025, are approximately 822,030 soldiers. The General Staff reported that 1600 Russian soldiers were either killed or wounded in the past 24 hours. Ukrainian forces have retaken lost positions near Chasiv Yar and Toretsk, while Russian forces continue their offensive operations. 'The overall combat losses of the enemy are estimated to be: ' 
Original language: ru
Publish date: January 21, 2025 05:39 AM
Source:[ТСН.ua](https://tsn.ua/ru/ato/skolko-okkupantov-otpravilis-v-ad-za-minuvshie-sutki-svodka-genshtaba-2748549.html)

**Russian Defense Ministry Report on the Conduct of the Special Military Operation (as of January 20, 2025)**
The Russian Armed Forces continue to conduct a special military operation. The following key points were reported: On the Kharkiv direction, the 'North' group of troops inflicted significant losses on the Ukrainian Armed Forces (VSU) in the Volchansk area, with up to 20 VSU personnel, 2 vehicles, and a radio-electronic warfare station destroyed. The 'West' group of troops liberated the settlement of Noveegorovka in the Luhansk People's Republic, inflicting significant losses on the VSU, including up to 400 personnel, a 'Bradley' infantry fighting vehicle, and 3 armored personnel carriers. The 'South' group of troops occupied advantageous positions and inflicted significant losses on the VSU, including up to 220 personnel, a combat vehicle, and 4 ammunition depots. The 'Center' group of troops continued to advance, liberating the settlement of Shevchenko in the Donetsk People's Republic, inflicting significant losses on the VSU, including up to 545 personnel, 2 M113 armored personnel carriers, and a 122mm self-propelled howitzer. The 'East' group of troops continued to advance, inflicting significant losses on the VSU, including up to 140 personnel, a tank, a combat vehicle, and 2 'Caesar' self-propelled howitzers. The 'Dnieper' group of troops inflicted significant losses on the VSU, including up to 65 personnel, 6 vehicles, and an artillery piece. In total, Russian forces have destroyed: 652 aircraft, 283 helicopters, 40,878 drones, 590 surface-to-air missile systems, 20,684 tanks and other armored vehicles, 1,510 multiple rocket launchers, 20,809 artillery and mortar pieces, and 30,501 special military vehicles.
Original language: ru
Publish date: January 20, 2025 12:10 PM
Source:[pandoraopen.ru](https://pandoraopen.ru/2025-01-20/svodka-ministerstva-oborony-rossijskoj-federacii-o-xode-provedeniya-specialnoj-voennoj-operacii-po-sostoyaniyu-na-20-yanvarya-2025-g/)

**Russia's Losses in 2024 Were Greater Than in the Two Previous Years, Says Syrskyi**
According to General Alexander Syrskyi, the Russian army has lost 434,000 personnel in 2024, including around 150,000 killed. Syrskyi stated, 'For the year 2024, the enemy lost more than in the two previous years of the full-scale war.' In total, Russia has lost 818,740 personnel in the live forces since the start of the full-scale war. Additionally, the enemy has also lost equipment, with the General Staff reporting that by January 19, 2025, the opponent had already lost: [no specific numbers mentioned in the article, only a statement that the General Staff reported losses, but no specific numbers were provided].
Original language: uk
Publish date: January 19, 2025 06:47 PM
Source:[24tv.ua](https://24tv.ua/za-2024-rik-vtrati-rosiyi-buli-bilshimi-nizh-za-dva-poperedni_n2733203)

**British Intelligence Reports Unprecedented Russian Losses in 2024**
According to a report by the British Ministry of Defence, Russia has suffered unprecedented losses in 2024, with 429,000 military personnel killed or wounded. This is significantly higher than the previous years, with 105,960 in 2022 and 252,940 in 2023. The total losses of Russian forces since the start of the full-scale invasion of Ukraine have exceeded 750,000 people. The report notes that Russian losses have been increasing for six consecutive months, peaking in December with 48,670 casualties, the highest number since the start of the war. The General Staff of the Ukrainian Armed Forces estimates that as of January 15, the total losses of Russians are around 812,670 people. The Pentagon estimated Russian losses at 600,000 in October 2024. The report also mentions the pressure on the centre of the Donetsk region, particularly the city of Velika Novosilka, with Russian forces advancing in the north of the region after capturing Ugledar in October 2024 and Kurakhovo in early January 2025.
Original language: ru
Publish date: January 19, 2025 05:30 PM
Source:[hvylya.net](https://war.hvylya.net/305788-britanskaya-razvedka-ocenila-poteri-rossii-v-2024-godu)

**Russia's Losses Reach 804,930 Personnel, General Staff Reports**
According to the General Staff, Russia has lost approximately 804,930 personnel. Ukrainian forces have destroyed three PVO systems and 32 enemy armored vehicles over the past day. Russia has lost 1,830 soldiers on the front lines over the past day, as reported by the General Staff. The total estimated losses of the enemy from February 24, 2022 to January 10, 2025 are: 'We remind you that the warriors of the Spartan Brigade struck at the positions of the Russians on the Zaporizhzhia direction. The enemy's satellite communication was destroyed.' The General Staff reports that Russia has lost a significant number of soldiers and equipment over the past day.

**Huge blow to Vladimir Putin as Russia loses nearly 1,400 soldiers on first day of 2025**
Russia suffered a significant loss on the first day of 2025, with Ukraine's military authorities reporting nearly 1,400 casualties, including fatalities and injuries. This brings the total number of Russian casualties since the onset of the conflict on February 24, 2022 to 792,170, according to Ukraine. The announcement was made on social media platform X, alongside a quote from science fiction writer Arthur C Clarke, 'The limits of the possible can only be defined by going beyond them into the impossible.'

Publish date: January 02, 2025 08:42 PM

summary: After evaluating the situation in both phases, the forecasting experts have generally increased their confidence that 900,000 Russian personnel losses will be reported by March 21, 2025. In Phase 1, experts estimated high probabilities, ranging from 65% to 100%, based on the consistent daily casualty rate of over 1,000, specifically around 1,300 per day, since July 2024. The initial predictions were supported by the current reported total of 862,390 casualties as of February 19, 2025, and the expected continuation of conflict intensity. In Phase 2, after reviewing recent reports indicating significant Russian personnel losses in February 2025 and consistent daily losses of over 1,000, most experts revised their probabilities upwards. The revised probabilities ranged from 75% to 100%, with experts factoring in the likelihood of continued high conflict intensity and reporting consistency. Overall, experts concluded that reaching the 900,000 casualty threshold by the target date is highly likely if current trends persist.
